licence_overview:
To practise as an art therapist in the UK, you need to register with the [Health and Care Professions Council (HCPC).](http://www.hpc-uk.org/ "Health and Care Professions Council"){:rel="external"}

This includes using any of the following protected titles:

* art psychotherapist
* art therapist
* drama therapist
* music therapist

To be eligible to apply for registration, you must:

* hold an approved qualification
* be in good physical and mental health
* be of good character

You must enclose a fee and any necessary supporting documents with your [application](http://www.hpc-uk.org/apply/ "HCPC application forms"){:rel="external"} (eg qualifications and a character reference.)

The registration fee for the two-year registration cycle is £152 (£76 per year) and there is a one off non-refundable scrutiny fee of £53. The registration fee is reduced by 50 per cent if you successfully completed a UK approved programme within the last two years.

If your application is successful, your name will be added to the register and you will receive a registration certificate and authentication card.

##Conditions

You must undertake continuing professional development (CPD) activities as a condition of your registration. You must keep a written record these activities, including any supporting evidence, and submit this for inspection by the HCPC on request.

If the HCPC isn't satisfied that you are meeting your CPD obligations, your name may be removed from the register.

##Fines and penalties

%It is a criminal offence to call yourself an art psychotherapist, art therapist, drama therapist or a music therapist if you are not registered with the HCPC. If you do so, you may be fined up to £5,000.%

*[HCPC]: Health and Care Professions Council
*[CPD]: continuing professional development
